channel.title: Comments on: A new feathered dinosaur â€“ worth getting ruffled for?

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/a-new-feathered-dinosaur-worth-getting-ruffled-for/#comment-352">elodieunderglass</a>.
Hmm. Doesn't seem to be working for me. Would it be ok if you emailed it to jon.tennant.2@gmail.com please? Thanks in advance!! :)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to elodieunderglass.

Hmm. Doesn’t seem to be working for me. Would it be ok if you emailed it to jon.tennant.2@gmail.com please? Thanks in advance!! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: elodieunderglass
item.dc:creator: elodieunderglass
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/a-new-feathered-dinosaur-worth-getting-ruffled-for/#comment-351">protohedgehog</a>.
Sure, it's <a> here</a> (that should work?) You might be interested in "Colless's index of phylogenetic tree imbalance" which relates discovered creatures to their impact on their trees.
And <a> here</a> is an amusing Google Trend showing that it's all pretty recent...
item.content:encoded:
In reply to protohedgehog.

Sure, it’s here (that should work?) You might be interested in “Colless’s index of phylogenetic tree imbalance” which relates discovered creatures to their impact on their trees.

And here is an amusing Google Trend showing that it’s all pretty recent…

item.title: By: protohedgehog
item.dc:creator: protohedgehog
item.description:
In reply to <a href="http://fossilsandshit.com/a-new-feathered-dinosaur-worth-getting-ruffled-for/#comment-350">elodieunderglass</a>.
<em>Anchiornis</em> is certainly an awesome li'l dino :)
Yes please!! That would be absolutely awesome! Is the paper freely available?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to elodieunderglass.

Anchiornis is certainly an awesome li’l dino ðŸ™‚

Yes please!! That would be absolutely awesome! Is the paper freely available?

item.title: By: elodieunderglass
item.dc:creator: elodieunderglass
item.description:
Aaaw, Anchiornis is my favorite, definitely.
<blockquote>If anyone has an idea about how to approach such a project, please do leave a comment or get in touch!</blockquote>
Would you be interested in a paper my husband did on sampling and media reports WRT non-avian dinosaurs? There are a few citations & some data analysis that you might be able to use.
And based on anecdotal evidence from colleagues and my own blog, I'm pretty sure that it's mostly because feathery freaks are super-sexy and the public respond really well to them!
item.content:encoded:
Aaaw, Anchiornis is my favorite, definitely.

If anyone has an idea about how to approach such a project, please do leave a comment or get in touch!

Would you be interested in a paper my husband did on sampling and media reports WRT non-avian dinosaurs? There are a few citations & some data analysis that you might be able to use.

And based on anecdotal evidence from colleagues and my own blog, I’m pretty sure that it’s mostly because feathery freaks are super-sexy and the public respond really well to them!
